nofarm.py - stand-in for farm.py¶

Author:Andreas Heger
Release:$Id$
Date:April 02, 2014
Tags:Python

Purpose¶

This script is a stand-in for farm.py - execute a cmd on the cluster. Instead of running splitting the input and running jobs on the cluster, the command is executed as is.

This script accepts all the options of farm.py, but ignores most of them.

Usage¶

Example:

python nofarm.py --help

Type:

python nofarm.py --help

for command line help.

Command line options¶

Usage: nofarm.py [options]

Options:
  --version             show program's version number and exit
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --no-usage            output help without usage information
  --split-at-lines=SPLIT_AT_LINES
                        split jobs according to line number [default=none].
  --split-at-column=SPLIT_AT_COLUMN
                        split jobs according to column. Columns start at
                        number 1 and the input should be sorted by this column
                        [default=none].
  --group-by-regex=GROUP_BY_REGEX
                        group jobs according to a regular expression
                        [default=none].
  --split-at-regex=SPLIT_AT_REGEX
                        split jobs according to a regular expression
                        [default=none].
  --split-at-tag=SPLIT_AT_TAG
                        split a file at a tag [default=none].
  --chunksize=CHUNKSIZE
                        when splitting at regex or tag, aggregate x entries
                        [default=none].
  --debug               debug mode. Do not delete temporary file
                        [default=False].
  --dry-run             dry run. Do not split input and simply forward stdin
                        to stdout - useful for debugging the command
                        [default=False].
  --input-header        The input stream contains a table header. This header
                        is replicated for each job [default=False].
  --output-header       The output jobs contain a table header. The header is
                        removed for each job except for the first
                        [default=False].
  --output-tag=OUTPUT_TAG
                        The output jobs contain a tag in the last line
                        denoting job completion. If the unix return value
                        denotes an error, the presence of this tag is checked
                        [default=# job finished].
  --subdirs             Run within separate subdirs for jobs. This permits
                        multiple output streams. Use a placeholder %DIR% if
                        you supply the ouput pattern as a command line option
                        [default=False].
  -T TMPDIR, --tmpdir=TMPDIR
                        Temporary directory to be used. Default is the current
                        directory [default=./].
  --max-files=MAX_FILES
                        create at most x files [default=none].
  --max-lines=MAX_LINES
                        in addition to splitting into chunksize, also split if
                        more than max-lines is reached [default=none].
  --renumber=RENUMBER   renumber ids consecutively, supply a pattern
                        [default=none].
  --renumber-column=RENUMBER_COLUMN
                        specify column to renumber. The format is
                        regex:column, for example csv:1 or csv:id
                        [default=[]].
  -r REDUCE, --reduce=REDUCE
                        Add reduce functions for specific files. The format is
                        file:reducer. The default reducer is 'table' for all
                        files [default=[]].
  -m MAP, --map=MAP     Map specific columns in tables. The format is
                        file:column:pattern, for example .table:1:%06i
                        [default=[]].
  --resume=RESUME       resume aborted run from files in dir [none]
  --collect=COLLECT     collect files in dir and process as normally [none]
  --binary              the output is binary - files are concatenated without
                        parsing [False]
  --resubmit=RESUBMIT   if a job fails, automatically resubmit # times. Set to
                        0 in order to disable resubmission [5]
  --fail                if a job fails, do not resubmit [5]
  --bashrc=BASHRC       bashrc file to use [~/.bashrc]
  --method=METHOD       method to submit jobs [drmaa]
  -e ENVIRONMENT, --env=ENVIRONMENT
                        environment variables to be passed to the jobs [[]]
  --output-pattern=OUTPUT_PATTERN
                        Pattern for secondary output filenames. Should contain
                        a '%s' [default=%s].
  -v LOGLEVEL, --verbose=LOGLEVEL
                        loglevel [1]. The higher, the more output.
  --timeit=TIMEIT_FILE  store timeing information in file [none].
  --timeit-name=TIMEIT_NAME
                        name in timing file for this class of jobs [all].
  --timeit-header       add header for timing information [none].
  --random-seed=RANDOM_SEED
                        random seed to initialize number generator with
                        [none].
  --use-cluster         use cluster [False].
  --cluster-priority=CLUSTER_PRIORITY
                        set job priority on cluster [-10].
  --cluster-queue=CLUSTER_QUEUE
                        set cluster queue [all.q].
  --cluster-num-jobs=CLUSTER_NUM_JOBS
                        number of jobs to submit to the queue execute in
                        parallel [100].
  --cluster-options=CLUSTER_OPTIONS
                        additional options for cluster jobs, passed on to qrsh
                        [].
  -I FILE, --stdin=FILE
                        file to read stdin from [default = stdin].
  -L FILE, --log=FILE   file with logging information [default = stdout].
  -E FILE, --error=FILE
                        file with error information [default = stderr].
  -S FILE, --stdout=FILE
                        file where output is to go [default = stdout].
